Welcome to ASTR400B_Leach’s documentation!¶

This is documentation for code written during course ASTR 400B, Theoretical Astrophysics, running at the University of Arizona’s Steward Observatory, Spring 2020.

Instructor: Prof Gurtina Besla

TA: Rixin Li

galaxy.Galaxy class¶

class galaxy.galaxy.Galaxy(name, snap=0, datadir=None)[source]¶

A class to find, read and manipulate files for a single galaxy.

Needs to be initialized with a name, eg ‘MW’, ‘M31’.

Snap number is optional, defaults to zero.

Path to the data file is optional, it searches several plausible defaults.

all_particle_properties(type=None)[source]¶

Similar to single_particle_properties, except returns the full list optionally filtered by type.

filter_by_type(type, dataset=None)[source]¶
Input: particle type as integer, 1=DM, 2=disk, 3=bulge

optionally, a starting dataset other than self.data

Returns: subset data

get_array()[source]¶

Returns data in np.ndarray format

Pretty superfluous in Python (which has no private class members)

get_df()[source]¶

Returns data as pandas dataframe

get_filepath(datadir)[source]¶

Search for the required file and return a valid pathlib.Path object.

Pretty boring housekeeping code, but may make things more resilient.

get_qtable()[source]¶

returns data as astropy QTable with units

read_file()[source]¶

Read in a datafile in np.ndarray format, store in self.data.

Assumes path and filename are already set as instance parameters.

Returns: nothing

single_particle_properties(type=None, particle_num=0)[source]¶

Parameters: particle_num: zero-based index to an array of particles type: optionally, use a subset of the data filtered by

1=DM, 2=disk, 3=bulge

returns: 3-tuple of

Euclidean distance from CoM (kpc), Euclidean velocity magnitude (km/s), particle mass (M_sun)
